titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Records of the Virginia Office of Civilian Defense, 1940-1945.
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia 22499
titlepage.author: Paige Neal

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Records of the Virginia Office of Civilian Defense,

arrangement.p: Arranged by type of record and chronologically or alphabettically thereunder.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Privacy protected and other protected information is considered confidential and restricted from public access for 75 years. It may be necessary for an archivist to review any unprocessed, modern record collections (those collections less than 75 years old) that may contain confidential information before the records can be used by patrons for research purposes or before any copies of records can be made for patrons. If you are planning to use these records, please contact Archives Reference Services for more details before planning your research trip.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Records of the Virginia Office of Civilian Defense, 1940-1945. Accession 22499, State government records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Accession 22499 was transferred by the Virginia World War II History Commission on 8/10/1950

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following series:

scopecontent.p: This series is housed in XX boxes and is arranged alphabetically by surname of correspondent or by company name. These files consist of copies of the outgoing correspondence of the Director of the Office of Civilian Defense, J. H. Wyse. Files were kept separately for 1942 and for 1943-1945 and that arrangment is reflected in this series.
